text: so when it comes to luggage I actually
think I've been pretty lucky considering
the amount of travel that I've done over
my life and the amount of planes that
I've been on I am NOT a carry-on only
traveler I've never been a carry-on only
traveler I just had too much stuff in
regards to camera gear there's a lot of
cameras and batteries and cords and
laptops etc that I don't want to check
and takes up a lot of my carry-on space
also I don't like carrying just a lot of
carry-on stuff because while I might be
very lucky in terms of luggage I'm not
so lucky in terms of connecting times I
tend to run a lot between connecting
flights this is something but just and
also just generally don't like lugging
around a whole bunch of stuff with me
through airports so therefore I do have
check luggage and pretty much all these
problems would not happen if I was
carry-on only so if you've ever had a
delayed or a cancelled flight you might
have experienced something called bag
limbo
now bag limbo is when you've checked
your bag but the airline can't release
it from their system because you're
either don't have a new flight yet
because your flight was canceled or your
flight is just so far in the future that
you know even if you wanted to get your
bag out they can't essentially do just
they cannot release your bag from the
system I don't know technically why that
is so but you aren't getting your bag
now where this comes into place is
overnight stays like if you are staying
overnight in a hotel which has happened
to me multiple times where I've not been
able to get my BAE out of bag limbo
because it's checked even though I would
like to you know shower change my
clothes do all these things that you
like to do when you're getting ready for
a new day so the first thing I do is I
ask the airline for a toiletry bag
sometimes they offer it up to you other
times you need to ask most airlines do
have a complimentary toiletry bag that
they will give you so normally these
bags contain a mixture of essentials
such as toothpaste toothbrush deodorant
then you have other things such as a
razor it's not much but it's enough to
make you not stink and then when you get
back to the airport they just recheck
your bag and you're on your next flight
and this is the first reason of why you
keep your luggage tag always when you
are traveling because that is how
they're gonna get your bag out of bag
limbo and put it on to your next flight
now the second reason why you always
want to keep your baggage tag is lost
bags so when you've made it to your
destination but your bag has not now
this has happened to me several
different times on my travels a few
times when I'm heading toward a
destination and that's my least favorite
scenario and a couple times when I'm
heading home which I'm like me so a
couple things that you do when you
arrive at a destination but your bag
does not the first thing is you go to
the baggage counter which is generally
in the same area that you would collect
your baggage in and you make a claim
where they will ask for your baggage a
tag and they will ask you to identify
your bag I generally like colorful bags
for this reason because it gives me that
peace of mind that when I'm describing
it I'm like yes it is a yellow bag with
a winky smiley face on it they will know
exactly which bag is my bag
then it's a black bag about yay high and
it looks like a bag so the next thing
that generally has happened is I will
just head to my hotel
like when my bag was lost in Germany and
I was going to a conference I like to
add in a little bit of a buffer day just
to like one or hopper from jet lag the
other thing is to just deal with if my
bag is missing or just to shower it's
put myself together I had a very tight
connection and as we were taking a tight
connection out of Vancouver I was like
hey is my bag gonna make it
and the airline lady said yes it is
spoiler alert a bag did not make it to
Germany but that's okay because I
luckily in that case had a couple
friends I bought some clothes room I
went to the shops and I picked up some
extra toiletries some makeup just so I
could put myself together for a
conference so this is another
great reason why you should get travel
insurance because they will generally
compensate you back for although I
didn't say you need to buy sometimes the
airline's themselves compensate you I
know in Europe they have like a
compensation system this isn't true
everywhere else in the world
another thing they'll ask you for is
your address because they will deliver
it to your hotel or your accommodation
when they have found your bag and
fingers crossed that they have found
your bag but there is another situation
though when they can't find your bag and
it's not in their system anymore and
that's because someone could have
mistakenly taken your bag so this
happened to me when I flew into Auckland
New Zealand and I had my backpack that I
had checked and so I realized that after
seeing my identical bag on the carousel
still that someone else had indeed taken
my bag probably by accident because they
looked exactly the same the person who
took my bag did eventually realize that
they took my bag they called the airline
up but they didn't realize this until
after they were at the hotel and I
unfortunately was just stopping over in
Auckland for a night and I was heading
down to the South Island for Wellington
and then Wellington through Queenstown
I had many flights to go on trying to
track a bag through many flights it's a
very tricky scenario those where I
learned two very valuable lessons the
first one is the importance of
identifier so colorful straps luggage
tag stickers anything that separates
your bag even if it's colorful away from
everybody else's so if somebody
accidentally grabbed it they would know
in like a few seconds oh wait that's not
my bag and put it back the second
important thing that I learned was to
not put personal effects in my checked
luggage and what I mean by this is I had
put my diary my journal my notebook that
contained all of my important
information luckily that person I
assumed didn't go through my bag they
realized it was not their bag and just
returned it but they could have a very
well gone through it or if a malicious
person had taken my bag you know so
after a couple days of my bag following
me throughout all of New Zealand it did
eventually end up in Queens
and I was reunited with my bag but it
was multiple days in York if you're
gonna be like constantly traveling or if
you're driving like imagine if I was
like road tripping out to the middle of
nowhere right after my flight this is
where lost luggage becomes a big pain in
the butt and then there were the times
that my bag was damaged in transit so it
just came out with a new crack new bump
a dent the wheels weren't working the
handle wasn't working things had fallen
off its so the biggest thing to note is
that when that happens is that you have
to make a claim before you leave the
airport generally the airlines will
compensate you if that does happen but
you have to you know deal with it before
you leave the airport make a claim there
and it helps if you have photos of the
condition of the bag beforehand this is
why I always recommend to take a photo
of your luggage doesn't have people for
every trip but to have a photo of the
luggage that you have this is again for
identifying purposes
and for if you need to make that claim
because the airline had broken your
luggage so these are just some of the
things that have happened to me with my
luggage over by many years of traveling
